value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">And yet the tragic motive <del>is</del> broods over their</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[acts?] & trampling vanguards; over their multitudes</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">confusion & splendour. Are we not entranced into a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sense of tragedy ? Do we not foretell the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[funereal?] [illeg.]? Such tremendous blows</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the smiling & the kneeling king, the pride of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">rampant emperor knock. And they,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">as in in the [hoal?] [timely?] at one moment</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">still and heavy from the [firmament?] into</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">press of their [being] & splendour we hear:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">this art is keeping somehow: a break in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[struggle?]; a sign that the <del>auth</del> dramatist</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is separating from the anonymous play maker:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a sign that there is as yet no little</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">language: so that he cannot amalgamate</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[flow?] naturally; <del>from</del> <del>the</del> diction from</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">rhetoric, & speak, <del>with</del> simply.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-tmal" key="Marlowe, Christopher">Marlowe</rs> was swept away by his characters.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">For, the audience, the shopkeepers, soldiers, [align?]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">crowding to the stage, <del>f</del> <del>spurred</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>spurr</del> implored not [stillness?], but movement,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[illeg.]. <del>We</del> The play is still</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">partly the work of the audience: of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">undifferentiated mass. It is not yet a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">separate book. It is imprinted by the common</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">voice, demanding great names, many</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">multitudes, a whole clamour on</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">stage, not reflection, not the <del>brooding</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">subtlety of one soul. An orgy, a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[shapioly?], a spendid [illeg.]:</l>

<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>with</l>
            <l>tremendous</l>
            <l>clash &</l>
        </add>

<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>38</l>
          </add>

our souls, whose faculties can comprehend,

The wonderous architecture of the world,

And measure every wandering planet's course,

Still climbing after knowledge infinite

Will us to wear ourselves & never [rest?] ––
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">our souls are still the souls of many;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& so the single statement falls out of place</l>
